name: samantha
dataSource: Super enriched combining V6, V7, V8, V10, V11
culturalSignificance: The name Samantha gained popularity in the English-speaking world in the 18th century and has since become a staple name in many cultures. It is often associated with intelligence and empathy, reflecting its meaning 'listener.'
modernContext: Samantha remains a popular name in many English-speaking countries, frequently appearing in the top 100 names for girls. It is favored for its classic yet modern appeal.
literaryReferences: Samantha is a character in the popular TV series 'Bewitched,' where she is portrayed as a kind and magical housewife.
personality: Individuals named Samantha are often perceived as empathetic, intelligent, and strong-willed. They are seen as good listeners and are known for their ability to connect with others on a deep level.
symbolism: The name Samantha symbolizes attentiveness and understanding, reflecting the qualities of a good listener.
funFact: The name Samantha became widely popular in the United States after the character Samantha Stephens from the TV show 'Bewitched' became a household name in the 1960s.

achievements: Became a symbol of peace during the Cold War
Wrote a letter to Soviet leader Yuri Andropov
historicFigures.significance: Samantha Smith was an American schoolgirl who became famous for her peace activism during the Cold War.

moviesAndShows.title: Bewitched
moviesAndShows.characterDescription: A witch who marries a mortal and tries to live a normal life.

characterQuotes.quote: I am a witch. A real house-haunting, broom-riding, cauldron-stirring witch.
characterQuotes.context: Samantha reveals her true nature to her husband, Darrin.
characterQuotes.impact: This quote is iconic as it encapsulates the show's premise of a witch trying to live a normal life.

songs.title: Samantha
